children.subject: Best answer - ask professor if alternate will be offered. Often if they know there's a conflict with other large classes, then they consider offering an alternate. This is completely at instructor discretion however.

When I had 3 finals on the same day (Friday!) I asked all of my professors/TAs if it was possible to take an alternate final and I was able to move one of the dates. For large classes like 16B and 70 I would assume that they have alternate final slots so it might be worth it to ask the instructor if it is possible take the alternate final.

all online classes have a final time of Thursday 11:30

https://registrar.berkeley.edu/scheduling/academic-scheduling/final-exam-guide-schedules

Last I knew the room assignments weren't settled yet. You can always check classes.berkeley.edu (on the left side of the screen)  When the room assignment is final, a category will appear for Final Exam and you can expend it to see the date/time and room assignment.
Where did you find out that the slot is Thursday at 11:30? I can't find this information.

history.content: since this is an online class in the Spring, I guess I'm screwed again since the slot is for Th 11:30 and I already have an 8am (EE16B) and a 3pm (CS70) final that day.  Is there any possibility that that final will be on a different day?
history.subject: 186 final in Spring
